title: The dems typographic agenda revealed...
content:
New Congress, Old Fights; Choosing Teams for 2008  
Wall Street Journal (subscription), NY - 9 hours ago

[http://online.wsj.com/google\_login.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fonline.wsj.com%...](http://web.archive.org/web/20101029193330/http:/online.wsj.com/google_login.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fonline.wsj.com%2Farticle%2FSB116794649820267463.html%3Fmod%3Dgooglenews_wsj "http://online.wsj.com/google\_login.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fonline.wsj.com%2Farticle%2FSB116794649820267463.html%3Fmod%3Dgooglenews\_wsj")

\>In release to members and reporters, new House Majority Leader Hoyer prints Democrats' first-day agenda in typeface called "Comic."

The Times are indeed a-changin'
author: Sii Daniels

comments.content:
Stenny Hoyer is a Comic Sans Fan?

ChrisL

Where is Vince, he is gonna love this :-)

ChrisL
Sheesh, I thought all the really brain-dead staffers that do stuff like this are on the _other_ side of the aisle.
I think the font choice fits - the Dems are fun! Any GOP staffer that were to divert from Times would have been taken out and shot as some kind of lefty "creative" type.
Had I known they were running on a pro Comic-sans platform, I never would have voted for them.

Direct link for the handful of non WSJ subscribers out there ;-)

[http://blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2007/01/05/new-congress-old-fights-choosin...](http://web.archive.org/web/20101029193330/http:/blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2007/01/05/new-congress-old-fights-choosing-teams-for-2008/ "http://blogs.wsj.com/washwire/2007/01/05/new-congress-old-fights-choosing-teams-for-2008/")

The Comic quote is at the bottom of the post.

Hey, if we can somehow make Congress aware of [_Ban Comic Sans_](http://web.archive.org/web/20101029193330/http:/bancomicsans.com/ ": Putting the Sans in Comic Sans"), maybe they could actually do it!
When governments try to make things illegal it usually just makes them more popular.
